intro: Thecacoris grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered cacoris, is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, often fragrant flowers. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and dark green coloration. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels, displaying a range of colors from white to pink, and are pollinated primarily by insects. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water.
